file_content.text: Don't tell, but I kinda glossed over our job. It took everything I had not to skip the meeting and just-- just--
Just that.... If you've got something to say I'd make it quick or you're going to get interrupted.
I've crossed the span of stars and time for this momen--
Don't rush, my love.
It can wait.
[Flirt] Interrupt away.
This is... a shock, Vette. Give me some room to take it all in.
Some space, please.
But I-- We-- You aren't excited? I can hardly breathe!
I don't think I've ever been happier.
I was just overwhelmed.
And here I thought it was the atmosphere.
[Flirt] I like that feeling.
Until this afternoon we were widowers.
Contain yourself.
Things between us can't be like they were. A lot has happened. Now isn't the time to hear about it all.
You... stupid... heartless... jerk!
Just forget I said anything. I need to go find a dark hole to crawl into that isn't related to work.
So, you're not dead. That's good. I guess.
I know it's going to be hard having to hear an opinion or acknowledge that I have feelings, but I'm not "yours" anymore.
There's no collar, and no us. Just the job. Don't make it weird.
We each have our own reasons for being here, let's leave it at that.
Very well.
Glad that's cleared up.
I hardly imagined you'd be pleased to see me. I'm pleased to see that you're alive, none the less.
It's good you're okay.
Missed your favorite target for abuse?
I don't need the collar to put you in your place, Vette.
I can do more than shock you.
Yeah, you're the big bad Sith. I know.
I like the way things are for me now. You coming back into the picture isn't going to change that. I won't let it.
You need something, you're going to have to ask. Nicely.
Sorry about the prank earlier. If I'd known you were here-- or, you know, alive-- I'd have held off... but I finally got him!
I hope you'll be taking the task at hand more seriously. There doesn't seem to be room for error.
Be more careful.
Don't you worry about me. I'll be the best living lockpick you've ever seen.
How long have you been trying, Vette?
Finally?
Eh, we haven't worked together a ton... so, maybe a dozen? He's a sly one.
Same rampant troublemaker, I see.
You'll never grow up.
Same grumpy serious-face, I see.
It's still hard to believe you're really here. It's been what? Five years since we went after your old boss?
Did you get konked on the head real good? Amnesia maybe?
Locked in a block of carbonite with nothing by my dreams to pass the time.
That's, uh, pretty bad-- but better than dead, right?
Did you... dream about me in there?
I saw you. I saw everyone. The Eternal Empire spared none.
I had visions.
Every chance I got.
Always.
You're going to tell me about every single one.
I never realized you were this vain.
Self-centered much?
Hey! I just want hear that I'm as important to you as you are to me. Is that so bad?
Were the dreams good, at least?
Maybe a certain someone waiting on you hand on foot, groveling at your every word, maybe wearing a shock collar? Quinn, I'm talking about Quinn.
I forgave him long ago.
I wouldn't do that.
Oh, I know, but that doesn't mean you can't take a little guilty pleasure in it.
You are a practiced dreamer, aren't you?
Inventive thought.
Being a slave tends to make you real good at it.
Anything juicy? Bet you saw a lot of Lieutenant Muscles.
Pierce has often made for good company in a long cold night.
He has his uses.
Hee hee, I knew it! You aren't so far from normal after all.
And what affair of yours is that?
Like I'd tell you.
Oooo, touched a nerve. Say no more!
Lots of cowering masses and Imperials marching? That's my best guess.
I watched you all die and Dromund Kaas burn as the Emperor's laughter echoed all around.
Nothing pleasant.
I know Sith probably measure on a different scale, but I'd call that more of a nightmare.
It's just a nightmare though. I'm still here. The rest too, far as I know, so don't sweat it! Not that there weren't rough patches....
Those things are only found in dreams these days.
We've fallen so far.
Aww, now that you're back I'm sure you'll have the whole galaxy quaking in terror in no time.
Dreams are nothing of consequence. Better to focus on reality.
Doesn't matter.
Reality's pretty overrated.
I should start warming up for this gig.
Gotta keep limber, you know.
We'll catch up again soon.
You look good, all things considered.
Maybe I should lie down for one of these deep freezes, see what it does for my complexion.
Can't recommend it.
I wouldn't.
Eh, perfection isn't meant to last anyway.
Sure you can commit to anything that long?
Doesn't seem like your thing.
Oh, come on, I get enough of that from from the old lady. Young lady? It's... still weird.
Yeah? Hold still.
Not funny, Gault.
Hey, hey, hey! Just breaking the ice, not looking to be it.
Hylo gave me the rundown. Not much of an early retirement if you ask me.
We came looking, you know? Even the angry tumor. It was about the third trip into the Spire when things started to come apart.
Lana and her crew barely managed it themselves.
I appreciate the effort.
Well, keep that to yourself. I don't like being one upped.
What happened?
Come apart?
It wasn't so much that anything happened as nothing really did.
Skadge helped? I thought you were a better liar.
You're just saying that.
Is it so hard believe he wanted to break things? Besides, I think you were the only one he didn't immediately look to strangle.
We knew better than to believe the Eternal Empire's cover story, but I've seen ghosts leave bigger traces. Probably on something we were doing.
We were going broke and turning up nothing. With the galaxy coming apart, priorities shifted and everybody wandered their separate ways.
Have to stick with the times.
That's how it goes.
Yeah, well, sorry.
There's no way Torian would give up on me.
What about my husband?
Last I saw, he was doing whatever gobbledygook word you people have for "kicking the stuffing out of" Zakuul.
I told Mako I'd always be there for her. I couldn't keep my promise.
Mako take it hard?
I think not knowing for sure what happened to you helped. You know how she gets when there's something she needs to find out.
Even the lovebirds?
Mako and Torian?
Couldn't say, but I know you meant a lot to the both of them.
I'd kinda hoped you'd all stick together. Guess I'm getting sentimental.
That's a shame.
Aren't we all. Word of advice from your elders: the longer you fight it, the harder it hits.
At least have the spine to say it like it is. You left me for dead.
"Priorities shifted"? Right.
If you wanted to be uncharitable about it, sure, but I've been getting plenty of practice in making up. I did come bearing gifts.
Compared to all that, this little caper should be a piece of cake.
Just be ready to show these amateurs what a couple old pros can do.
If you're still wondering why you're here, it isn't to check out the tibanna gas bars.
There's a stealth cruiser loaded with more precious metals than a Hutt's taste in art hiding down in the lower atmosphere, and it's about to come up for air.
And while the Gilded Star is roosting at the skyhook for its annual resupply, we're going to rob it blind!
How do you even know about that?
A little bird told us. I speak stool-pigeon.
Even if you do know where it's going to be, it's got a full military compliment onboard and a vault that could survive the ship being reduced to atoms.
Most people would consider it impregnable, but we aren't most people. Are we, Senya?
You do seem to know a lot about our target.
He's on to something.
Yes, well, I should. Overseeing the Gilded Star was among my duties when I still served Valkorion.
Then you were privy to its operational protocols.
I doubt they're still the same.
You don't have to run the thing, just get SCORPIO to the ship's control center.
There's no way we could infiltrate that far into the ship undetected.
Maybe, maybe not, but I'm pretty sure High Justice Vaylin can go wherever she pleases.
You're going to have Senya pose as Vaylin.
Hence the forger.
Let's just hear the rest of the plan before we start poking holes in it.
Hold off on the bickering.
You'll have better luck poking holes in the Gilded Star than the plan.
So, what, we get her permission?
That's relevant how?
Who needs her permission when you can be her?
We've got the best identity doctor this side of the galaxy and as close to a genetic match as we're going to get.
I could never match Vaylin's gene-sequence like that... though, maybe simulating data corruption in her ID....
And create enough doubt to bluff her way through. Dear old mom can manage that, right?
Once "Vaylin" and her "attache droid" are on board, they head to the bridge, seize control of the ship and allow the rest of us to do our parts.
Like cracking the vault. It isn't controlled by the network, so I've got to get into the guts of the ship to reach the mechanism. I'll need your help.
Meanwhile, Lana and Theron will bridge airlocks with a tanker transport I've secured for the goods.
Meanwhile, Lana and Koth will bridge airlocks with a tanker transport I've secured for the goods.
How are we going to carry an entire treasury's worth of loot out of the vault before anyone catches on?
Oh, we won't be carrying anything out of the vault. Into, that's another story.
Remember how Senya mentioned the vault could withstand everything outside being vaporized? Same applies to what we're setting off inside.
The warhead.
Exactly. I'll be pulling up the rear with the disintegration bomb. Once it's done its job, we pump the atmosphere into the waiting tanker and make our escape.
What's the exit strategy?
And the getaway?
This is so crazy it just might work.
That actually has potential.
I prefer "unconventional."
Because everything up to this point has been so simple.
"Just escape," right.
I don't know, running seems pretty straightforward to me.
Now, since we've got less than a day before the Gilded Star rolls into port, I'd suggest everybody get real familiar with their part.
Kid always was stubborn, and first love's are hard to let go.
You know, things haven't exactly been perfect out here either.
If you thought the Sith were treacherous before, you should have seen it after you and Marr disappeared.
I didn't have much reason to stick around once you were gone, so I left them to their infighting before the Eternal Empire rolled in. I... hope you don't mind.
As you said, your loyalty was to me.
It's fine.
And it still is! Don't count me out yet!
You found safety, that's what's most important.
I'm just glad you're alive.
There were some bumps along the way, but throwing in with Captain Shifty was one of my better moves. Don't tell him I said so.
You ran away as my home, my legacy, crumbled to dust?
I do mind.
No-- I... I guess you're right. Maybe I was running away. I'm sorry, I really am, but I'm here now. We're gonna rebuild it, you'll see!
Once that sucker explodes, the crew's going to notice. Everybody's just going to have to high tail it to the transport before they catch on.
